intro: Calopsis viminea, commonly known as the slender calopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Calopsis viminea is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
